name: Ibis Deira City Centre

reviews.text: I usually like the Accor group of hotels. Ibis is a good business hotel if you just have to use it for the night. This one, however, is not that great. The location is good, it's just across the street from the Deira City Center mall. However, the room I got was really small, very unlike the other Ibis'. The fixtures in the bathroom were hanging precariously and the amenities hanging on the walls kept falling from their hinges.
reviews.title: Good location, very average room

reviews.text: The bed was comfortable. The television channels, however, were primarily in Arabic (all dubbed) and that really did not help.
reviews.title: Location

reviews.text: Being a predominantly business hotel, one thing that is definitely lacking is the Wi-fi in rooms. It is available in the lobby, but since largely the guests are business travelers, this is a basic necessity that is missing.
reviews.title: Pathetic experience staying at ibis Deira City Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good location, rooms are clean and tidy, simple but does not contain a small fridge like other hotels. However, it was a good experience and recommend to friends and would like to stay again.
reviews.title: Great location
Service
reviews.text: Normally I reftrain complaining about services of hotels - as post my visits to more than 100 hotels worldwide in more than 30 countries - However, I thought of putting message here on this site to safeguard others from hotel called Ibis Deira City Centre, Dubai.

For the price we paid the room was shockingly small! I've stayed in small hotels such as in Japan but this Dubai hotel's room is even smaller! No cupboard, just a rack to hang clothes. No safety box. No coffee and tea making facilities. Really small toilet... It was clean but just so sub-standard when it comes to size and room facilities. We checked out after one night. Hotel lobby was nice and it does offer PC with free internet access in the lobby.
reviews.title: Unimpressed...

reviews.text: Quality of service provided is very poor compare with the same you can get at other Ibis in Dubai, as well as the standard of services is very poor. Breakfast room / restaurant quite dirty, which is the general feeling you get at the hotel.
reviews.title: There are better IBIS in Dubai !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a couple of nights for our quick stay in Dubai. The location is great - across the street from the Deira City centre and close to the Gold souk as well. We chose this hotel because the price was great and is under 10 minutes from Dubai International Airport.
reviews.title: Great for its price & location!

reviews.text: We went with a standard room that overlooked the Deira City centre. Room was clean and well kept with the usual amenities. Bathroom was a little tiny but was sufficient for the both of us.
reviews.title: Basic, clean and adequate

reviews.text: The hotel lobby has wifi for its customers as well as a snack store (which was steep so we didn't use). Checkin was smooth and staff are friendly & helpful.
reviews.title: Worthwhile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights during Ramadan. We arrived at 8am after quite a gruelling red-eye flight and were told, somewhat bizarrely, that the official check-in time was 2p.m., but we could pay extra to check-in immediately or if we waited until 10a.m. they would give us our room. We elected to wait and have a little snooze on the lobby soft furnishings, and were woken at 9.30a.m. by the same receptionist who had our room ready for check-in. I find this quite an odd situation, as they clearly had a room available for check-in at 8a.m. but were bizarrely trying to extract money from us for an early check-in (not the best customer service technique really, eh Ibis?).
reviews.title: Entirely ok.

reviews.text: The hotel basically does exactly what it says on the tin: comfortable double bed, pointless view of some office block from our second-floor window, decent shower in tiny bathroom, flat-screen TV with various international stations, small wardrobe, excellent location in the heart of Deira (fantastically close to the metro station, airport and Deira City Mall). Breakfast was mediocre at best and served behind a curtain with respect to Ramadan (fair enough). It was possible to walk straight through to the Novotel next door without going outside into the unbearable 48 degree heat. We went to the Vertigo bar in the Novotel, the first night we were alone and it was great (friendly service and reasonably-priced drinks, although no alcohol served before 8p.m. during Ramadan). However, on our second visit the place was crammed with businessmen sat alone and smoking like chimneys (you cannot smoke outside during Ramadan), which was pretty repulsive to a non-smoking British couple who are not used to windowless smoke-filled rooms since the smoking ban in England.
reviews.title: Great value for a short stopover

reviews.text: We decided not to eat at the hotel in the evenings, instead getting taxis to other more upmarket hotels on the Creek. We ate at excellent restaurants at the Radisson and the Hyatt that were short taxi rides away (£2.50 including a tip – Dubai taxis are cheaper than British trains and buses!). The bars at both were closed for the duration of Ramadan (common practice), but the restaurants were happy for us to keep our tables and have a few drinks after our meals, and the service and food at both were impeccable.
reviews.title: 0 value for money
Ibis Dubai
reviews.text: In summation, for a comfortable place to crash during a city break this place is absolutely fine – but no more than that. Reception, bar and breakfast staff were friendly enough, answering questions when asked in a perfunctory fashion. Rooms could really benefit from a mini fridge, a dressing table area and some half-decent towels (the threadbare towels were the worst I have ever encountered anywhere - they were practically transparent!). On the plus side, Dubai is such an exciting, bustling city with so much to do that you'll only ever really want the room to shower and sleep, both of which you can do in reasonable comfort.
I stayed in Dubai for two nights and searched for a reasonably priced hotel with good connection to the airport and sights/malls. And that is exactly what I got with the Ibis Deira City Centre.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel

reviews.text: The Ibis Deira City Centre has an excellent location adjacent to one of the main shopping malls in Dubai and is also a 5 minute walk to the metro system. The rooms are basic but more than adequate for the money being paid and though it lacks things like in room safes the reception area have safe deposit boxes for any valuables. The hotel has free wifi in the reception area and also 3 computers available for guests which are also free of charge which is a rarity in Dubai. Overall I found the Ibis to be great value for money considering its location. Tip - the hotel has its own private taxis but they are twice the price of the normal dubai taxis so better to wave a metered taxi down on the street if none are available outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Ibis for the second time as we were impressed the first time we stayed a couple of years ago.The location is ideal as it is close to the airport and everything that is worth seeing in Dubai is within easy reach.The only slight problem we had is that the beds are on the firm side for us but are otherwise very comfortable.Outside the hotel,the addition of the new monorail system is a real boon for getting around as it is cheap and easy to use.We used it as a great way to see much of the city as there are stops for most places of interest.If the monorail didn't go direct to where we wanted to be ,we got off at the nearest station to our destination and took a taxi for the rest of the way thus saving a lot of money for long fares.Opposite the hotel is the Deira city centre shopping mall.Good for shopping and watching the world go by.On the ground floor there is an excellent food mall where it is possible to get good food at reasonable rates as food in Dubai can be a bit pricey if eating in the bigger outlets.Go to the spice market and have some fun getting your spices from the local traders,they are all friendly but can be persistent once you are in the store,just be sure what you want and enjoy the experience!Dubai is a great place and we try to make it a stopover when we can as we find the experience is a great intro to the Arabian way of life.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: Me and a friend stayed here during our 2 day visit to Dubai. We were both pleasantly surprised at the service this hotel offered. While the front desk were often quite busy, they never refused to offer any assistance or help to us.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money

aka: Ibis Deira City Centre Hotel Dubai
